h1_38: Case Western Reserve University/University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center Program
h3_39: Case Western Reserve University/University Hospitals Cleveland Medical Center
p_65: Dashes ("-") indicate data for a particular field are not provided for this program in Residency Explorer. Reasons why data are not being provided can vary (e.g., they are not reported or available, they are not applicable, or they are based on an insufficient number of people for reporting purposes).
h3_69: # of Filled Resident Positions, by Year*
p_80: *Totals may vary from year to year due to off-cycle residents.
th_98: # of Residents Who Were Graduates of a Joint MD-PhD program
p_101: Our program features comprehensive training in general dermatology, procedural dermatology, pediatric dermatology, inpatient dermatology, dermatopathology, and medical dermatology with additional specialty training in cutaneous oncology, psoriasis and blistering diseases. Residents are encouraged to personalize their training by pursuing research in an area of interest, or an optional 2+2 academic research track. Our faculty have a diverse array of interests and are eager to mentor residents.

p_345: The race/ethnicity data are shown alone or in combination with other race/ethnicity responses. Because some individuals may report multiple races/ethnicities, the totals may not equal 100%. Only residents who are U.S. citizens or permanent residents are included in race/ethnicity counts.
